question: What is the role of the Specialization Committee in doctoral study programmes?
answer: The Specialization Committee monitors and assesses ongoing studies, updates and develops the doctoral study programme, and initiates proposals for new programmes.
answer_generated: The role of the Specialization Committee in doctoral study programmes is primary expert, controlling and evaluation bodies of the studies. Article 21(1). They report directly to the respective Scientific Council.
context:
Document 1: The decision -making  in this matter  is governed  by Section  68 of the Act. 
 
 Article  21 
Specialization  committees  
(1) Specialization  committees  for studies  in doctoral  study  programmes  (hereinafter  as “ORP”)  are 
primary  expert,  controlling  and evaluation  bodies  of the studies  (Section  47, Para  6 of the Act).  
 They  report  directly  to the respective  Scientific  Council.  
 (2) If the studies  in a doctoral  programme  are divided  into fields  of study,  Specialization  Committees  
can be set up for these  fields  of study  (hereinafter  as “ORO”)  that provide  expert  assessment  
activities  in the framework  of these  fields  of study.   Activities  undertaken  by ORO  and ORP  are 
defined  in Para  6 to 9 hereof.   
 (3) ORP  has at least  five members,  of which  at least  two are not employees  of CTU;  ORO  chairs  are in 
their  capacity  also automatically  members  of ORP.   Each  ORO  has at least  five members,  of which  
at least  two members  are not employees  of CTU.
